paper_abstract: Lower and upper bounds on the size of a covering of subspaces in the Grassmann graph by subspaces from the Grassmann graph , , are discussed. The problem is of interest from four points of view: coding theory, combinatorial designs, -analogs, and projective geometry. In particular we examine coverings based on lifted maximum rank distance codes, combined with spreads and a recursive construction. New constructions are given for with or . We discuss the density for some of these coverings. Tables for the best known coverings, for and , are presented. We present some questions concerning possible constructions of new coverings of smaller size.
